moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: Mistake? Perhaps Nbd2 would have been better here. Losing the bishop pair, even while gaining the extra pawn didn't work out so well for white.
moves.13... h6 14. Bh4 Nc6 15. Bg3 Nb4 16. Nbd: I'm winning a pawn here, but black's bishops become very active.
moves.19... dxe5 20. Nxe5 Rc8 21. Qd1: I saw pretty much everything that black was trying to do, but couldn't figure out how to stop it.
Computer recommends 30. Nd2 Bb7 31. Nf1 Rc8 32. Ne3 Rd8 33. Kf1 g6 34. Ke2 f5 35. g3 f4 36. gxf4 Bg7 37. Bxg7 Rxd1 38. Kxd1 Kxg7
moves.30... Rxc3: 30...Bxa3 31. Nd4 Bxb2 32. Nxc2 Bxc3 was another possibility which would've retained two passed pawns on the queenside for black.
moves.31. bxc3 Bc2 32. Rd8 Bxb3 33. Ra8 Bc4 34: 38...Bxa3 is perhaps more direct. But the text move certainly works.
